glsa.title: phpMyAdmin: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: phpMyAdmin contains multiple vulnerabilities which could lead to file disclosure or command execution.

background.p: phpMyAdmin is a tool written in PHP intended to handle the administration of MySQL databases from a web-browser.

description.p: Nicolas Gregoire (exaprobe.com) has discovered two vulnerabilities that exist only on a webserver where PHP safe_mode is off. These vulnerabilities could lead to command execution or file disclosure.

impact.p: On a system where external MIME-based transformations are enabled, an attacker can insert offensive values in MySQL, which would start a shell when the data is browsed. On a system where the UploadDir is enabled, read_dump.php could use the unsanitized sql_localfile variable to disclose a file.

workaround.p: You can temporarily enable PHP safe_mode or disable external MIME-based transformation AND disable the UploadDir. But instead, we strongly advise to update your version to 2.6.1_rc1.
